title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository houses a web-based interface, built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, designed for visualizing and interacting with data from robotic systems managed by Robofleet. This project provides a comprehensive dashboard for monitoring robot status, observing sensor data, and potentially controlling robot actions, offering a centralized hub for Robofleet-connected robot management.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 using the Pages Router, TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) for a modern and intuitive user interface. This project leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, offering a robust foundation for building scalable and performant web applications. Explore its codebase to learn best practices in Next.js development, TypeScript integration, and effective use of libraries like MUI and React Query.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. It provides a user-friendly interface to track sleep patterns, calculate accumulated sleep debt, and offer insights for optimizing sleep schedules. This project showcases practical application of TypeScript in web development and aims to promote better sleep hygiene.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript, exploring modern web development practices. This repository serves as a platform for experimenting with and showcasing different aspects of software development, focusing on practical application and learning through hands-on experience. It aims to demonstrate a functional and well-structured codebase, highlighting best practices in TypeScript and JavaScript project architecture.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern, responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository serves as a practical example for learning and implementing server-side rendering, efficient data fetching, and dynamic UI components within a Next.js application, focusing on best practices and a clean, maintainable codebase.

title: resume
description: This repository contains my resume, built using LaTeX for clean formatting and potentially converted to HTML for online viewing and accessibility. It showcases my skills and experience in a structured and visually appealing manner, serving as a project example for document generation and web presentation.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to provide a collaborative platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. Utilizing a modern web development stack, this application allows users to visually manage and prioritize project ideas, making it an effective tool for team collaboration and individual project management.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to provide a simple and intuitive platform for creating and participating in polls. This project showcases modern web development practices, offering features like user authentication, poll creation and management, and real-time vote counting, making it a valuable resource for learning and implementing interactive web applications.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, designed as a project to demonstrate backend development principles. It provides a foundation for creating and managing data through a web interface, showcasing the integration of a Python-based backend with a relational database and a user-friendly frontend.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository hosts a project focused on creating interactive map visualizations. Built using HTML for the front-end and Python for data processing and potentially backend logic, this project aims to present geographical data in a clear and engaging manner. It serves as a practical application of mapping techniques and data visualization principles, offering a template for similar projects.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern IoT asset tracking web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and styled with Tailwind CSS. It leverages Supabase for backend services, providing a robust and scalable solution for monitoring and managing assets. The project serves as a practical example of integrating these technologies to create a real-world IoT dashboard, exploring topics such as data visualization, real-time updates, and user interface design.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: This project, built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, is a dynamic event calendar that allows users to easily view and manage events. It provides a user-friendly interface for displaying events on a calendar, offering a visual and interactive way to schedule and track important dates. As a core project, it demonstrates practical application of front-end web development technologies in creating a functional and responsive event management tool.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains a collection of projects exploring financial concepts and analysis. It utilizes Python libraries to model financial scenarios, analyze stock data, and perform other finance-related tasks, providing practical examples for learning and applying Python in the financial domain.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository serves as a platform for [**Insert project's primary purpose here based on the README, e.g., showcasing interactive maps, providing a tool for data visualization, or serving as a personal portfolio**]. It demonstrates the use of modern web development techniques and explores concepts related to [**Mention a specific topic from the README, e.g., interactive mapping, data-driven UI, or responsive design**].

title: ros-log-viewer
description: Ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting designed to visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project provides a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and interpreting ROS logs to aid in debugging and understanding robot behavior, making it an essential utility for ROS developers.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project built with TypeScript, Express.js, Vite.js, and the Gemini API, designed to facilitate dynamic and engaging conversations powered by AI. This repository showcases the integration of modern web technologies to create an interactive platform for exploring and experimenting with generative AI capabilities through a clean and intuitive user interface built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (Pages Router) and TypeScript, leveraging MUI for the UI and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. This repository showcases a type-safe implementation of a fruit selling platform, demonstrating best practices in modern web development, including efficient state management, user interface design, and server-side rendering. It serves as a learning resource for developers interested in building robust and scalable e-commerce applications.
